definition: secretary (chief official of a branch of a socialist or communist party)/clerk/scribe
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: Alternatively, you may ask the Clerk for an Execution form?
sentences.chinese: 或者，你可以問書記官要一份執行表格。

sentences.english: Chen Qiufa was appointed Deputy Secretary of CPC Party Leadership Group of Ministry of Industry and Information Technology.
sentences.chinese: 陳求發任工業和信息化部黨組副書記。

sentences.english: Jeremiah used a scribe to write for him.
sentences.chinese: 耶利米用書記員來爲他記錄。

sentences.english: The clerk assisted the judge by looking up related precedents.
sentences.chinese: 這位書記官協助那位法官查閱有關判例。

sentences.english: Yanzhou Mining Group, Song, deputy secretary of Party Committee chaired the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 兗礦集團黨委副書記宋國主持會議。

sentences.english: We elected him secretary of the Party branch.
sentences.chinese: 我們選舉他爲黨支部書記。

sentences.english: The clerk assisted the judge by looking up related precedents. Her breathing was assisted by a respirator.
sentences.chinese: 這位書記官協助那位法官查閱有關判例。

sentences.english: Cheng Donghong is the executive secretary of China Association for Science and Technology.
sentences.chinese: 程東紅是中國科學技術協會書記處書記。

sentences.english: Cheng Donghong is the executive secretary of China Association for Science and Technology.
sentences.chinese: 程東紅是中國科學技術協會書記處書記。

sentences.english: The appearance of Apocalymon was recorded in a prophetic book from ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 太古的預言書記錄下來了啓示錄獸的出現。

sentences.english: After the congress, the secretariat moved from Shanghai to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 代表大會召開之後，書記處由上海遷到了北京。

sentences.english: Registry accumulates junk files, and your computer's performance suffers.
sentences.chinese: 書記官處堆積的垃圾文件，計算機的性能受到影響。

sentences.english: Governor of Hunan Province Mei Kebao also attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 省委副書記梅克保參加會見。

sentences.english: The book describes the artistic life of Beiqu (operas popular in the North of China) actors at that time.
sentences.chinese: 這本書記載了當時北曲演員的藝術活動。

sentences.english: Compendium of Materia Medica recorded 9 kinds of medical amphibians can be used as medicine.
sentences.chinese: 明代李時珍《本草綱目》一書記載藥用兩棲類9種。

sentences.english: He is just a flunky of the Party secretary.
sentences.chinese: 他不過是黨支部書記的跟屁蟲。

definition: head of a (government etc) department/section chief/section head/secretary/minister/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
administrative committee/management committee/abbr. for 管理委員會|管理委员会[guan3 li3 wei3 yuan2 hui4]
president of a club, committee etc
United Front Work Department of CCP Central Committee (UFWD)/abbr. for 統一戰線工作部|统一战线工作部[Tong3 yi1 Zhan4 xian4 Gong1 zuo4 bu4]
to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
CPPCC (Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference)/abbr. of 中國人民政治協商會議|中国人民政治协商会议[Zhong1 guo2 Ren2 min2 Zheng4 zhi4 Xie2 shang1 Hui4 yi4]
